result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy L Ried was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall sumbit a DNA sample to the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to S.B. due within 30 days of plea and sentencing and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo any counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Defendant Randy L Ried in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights have bee complied.  DA moves to dismiss enhancer in Count 1.  Plea of no contest.   Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists. Court dismisses and read in count 2.   Court finds defendant guilty and orders sentence withheld probation for one year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to SB due within 30 days of plea and sentencing preappred by probation; any other other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  One day sentence credit.   - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Randy L Ried in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Kezl waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty to all charges.    Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.  - rt
